Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of votes that Connie Mack IV has missed by stating that he has missed "almost half" of his votes, while the actual percentage is 6 percent.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the claim of Connie Mack IV missing almost half of his votes.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that missing almost half of the votes is a negative thing without providing any context or reasons for the missed votes.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by Dave Weldon, a Republican rival, who suggests that the claim might have been based on previous attacks against Mack and may not have factored in the second and third quarters of the year.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not specifying the time period for which the "almost half" of missed votes is being referred to.
